intro: Xanthosia atkinsoniana, commonly known as the Atkinson's xanthosia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
